result.execSummary:
The defendant Chrystal C Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co. Case No. 15CM468

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chrystal C Stone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Compensation Re:  Court Appointed Counsel Fees - $562.80 Atty Selsing
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:14 p.m. Defendant Chrystal C Stone in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM468 - Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CM468: Plea: Ct 1 - NC. 15CM491: Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Repeater enhancer dismissed. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 15CM468: Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. Cts 3 & 4- DRI.  Statement by DE.  Court orders: S/W 2 years probation as to each count concurrent - Conditions: 15CM468 only - 45 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, $1744 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, Atty fees $562.80 w/ 60 DTP or PP, 24 mo DL rev/24 mo IID. As to both counts - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, costs w/ 60 DTP DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court. Bond and atty fee deposits to be applied to attorney fees first. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S Requested and Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: 15CM468 & 15CM491-Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Selsing requests an additional status after 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 11:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Chrystal C Stone in court, in custody, appears via video, Pro Se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states the discussion that occurred yesterday in Court with her as to the Court Appt Counsel request, she would still request counsel as to this matter also.  ADA argues as to new bond.  Requests no contact provision be again put into place with other standard conditions with a request for $500 cash. Statement by Def as to bond - lives with victim.  NGP entered by the Court.  Court orders $1000 cash bond with conditions as requested.   STC Scheduled with companion matter scheduled yesterday - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Defendant inquires to the Court on how to remove victim from her home.  Court reminds Def of the strict no contact provision ordered.  Status conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
